Clean NA-heavy columns from a Data Frame or Tibble

Source: R/limpiar_na_cols.R
limpiar_na_cols.Rd

Remove columns whose proportion of NAs is higher than determined threshold. Setting threshold of 0.25 asks R to remove all columns with 25% or more NA values. Can be useful when dealing with large data frames, where many columns are redundant.

Usage

limpiar_na_cols(df, threshold)

Arguments

df

The Data Frame or Tibble object

threshold

Threshold of non-NA entries a column must exceed to be retained.

Value

Data Frame or Tibble with NA-heavy columns purged

Examples

limpiar_examples
#> # A tibble: 10 Ã— 5
#>    doc_id author_name       mention_content    mention_url platform_interactions
#>     <int> <chr>             <chr>              <chr>       <lgl>                
#>  1      1 don_quijote       "mi amigo sancho â€¦ www.twitteâ€¦ NA                   
#>  2      2 sancho_panza      "RT mi amigo sancâ€¦ www.twitteâ€¦ NA

#>  5      5 commander_miranda "nos han metido eâ€¦ www.fakeboâ€¦ NA

#>  9      9 pablo             "todos se unen a â€¦ www.instagâ€¦ NA                   
#> 10     10 pilar             "a mi me gustarÃ­aâ€¦ www.instagâ€¦ NA                   

limpiar_examples %>% limpiar_na_cols(0.1)
